recommendations: Vidhant Jain “It is rare that you come across a person like Mr. Devendra Agrawal. I have the opportunity to work under the wing of a person who is more a mentor than a boss. Working with Devendra has been pure pleasure – I have learnt all that I know about life and profession from him and he has been kind and patient with me during times when I could not live up to his expectations. Being one of the greatest motivators I have met, he is the “go to person” when conflicts arise. He looks out for his team but is not one to draw attention to himself deliberately – his work does that for him. He has built a reputation as someone who has a broad vision and this vision is what will take a company places. His simplicity is sure to leave everyone is awe. Any person would be happy have Devendra as his superior, he does't only mentor a person but is ready to go a step further to hand hold you and teach you if he finds you worthy of it. Thank you DA!”

volunteer_experience.info:
TiEcon 2015 is hosted by TiE, a global not-for-profit organization, established in 1992, focused on promoting and fostering entrepreneurs of Indian origin. With a network of 61 chapters across 17 countries, it is the world’s largest entrepreneurship support network.TiEcon Delhi 2014 saw participation from 1800 delegates from 30 cities across India and beyond.           TiEcon 2015 is hosted by TiE, a global not-for-profit organization, established in 1992, focused on promoting and fostering entrepreneurs of Indian origin. With a network of 61 chapters across 17 countries, it is the world’s largest entrepreneurship support network.TiEcon Delhi 2014 saw participation from 1800 delegates from 30 cities across India and beyond. It had more than 120 Speakers, 50 Supporting Partners and 40 Exhibitors over 2 days. EconomicTimes.com pegged it as the “biggest event targeting entrepreneurs in the country” and was widely covered by relevant press.

volunteer_experience.info: Established in 2001, IIT Bombay Alumni Association creates and maintains a life-long connection between the Institute and its alumni, who number more than 35,000. In collaboration with an extremely dedicated volunteer board of directors, the Alumni Association works to connect alumni, support students and build an unforgettable Institute experience through a diversity of events, programming and services.
